Example: Example 1: Acer rubrum; Example 2: Nasua_nasua; Nasua_narica
Description: A character vector containing all of the taxa used in the model(s).

Example: Example 1: presence only; presence abscence; abundance
Description: The type of records used in modeling.
If a temporal range of records was used, this is the earliest year used.  Abscence or NA implies that there was no lower limit.
If a temporal range of records was used, this is the latest year used.  Abscence or NA implies there is no upper boundary used.

  journal={Methods in Ecology and Evolution},
  year={2017},
  publisher={Wiley Online Library}
}
Description: A single bibtex format citation or a vector of bibtex format citations.
Environmental  variable names, preferably as they appear in the source.
The first year of the temporal range of climate data in the environmental layers.
The last year of the temporal range of climate data in the environmental layers.
A single bibtex format citation or a vector of bibtex format citations.
